content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The test cases are well defined and the logic isn't very hard to understand.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good problem to showcase the trick of sorting the events before processing.
This seems too complicated for reverse mode, as it is not clear from the inputs and outputs what is going on

Nice clash, solvable in Reverse, although it's a bit tricky at first to see what's happening.

Only change I would suggest is that it would be good to clarify that the "number of people in the bus at each observation time" means that if someone's hop-off time is equal to the observation time then they are not on the bus, but if their hop-on time is equal to the observation time, then they are on the bus. Not sure the best way to word it, but I think it's important to have the statement explain this for Fastest/Shortest mode.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because it provides valuable insights and aligns with the objectives of the project.

Goal
* Please mention that before the first hop-on time the bus is empty.

Input
* Line 2:
(a) Please add "space-separated" after "[[p]]".

(b) Please mention that in each pair the hop-on time and the hop-off time are separated by {{-}}.

* Line 4: Please add "space-separated" after "[[n]]".

* Please mention that all the times (in Line 2 and Line 4) are:
(a) times in the same day,
(b) in 24-hour time format, and
(c) written in the syntax of <<HHMM>>.

Output
* Please change "observed" to "observation" for consistency with Input and Constraints section.

Thanks.

Thank you!

I have slightly changed testcases 3 and 4, and given them a title, to make it explicit that they're specifically testing (and showcasing) what happens when hop-on time = observation time and hop-off time = observation time.
Please mention the times are "within the same day". Thanks.
But there is no notion of day in the problem. The times are just numbers.
Exactly, but you can always have cases like 2345-0007. That's why you have to specify in the constraints that such cases won't appear, i.e. all times are times in the same day.
Oh, right! I added a constraint. Thanks.
